node.title: Ex-Raider Henry Ruggs III Allegedly Drove 156 MPH, Twice Legal Limit of BAC Before Fatal Crash
node.alt: Former Las Vegas Raiders wide receiver Henry Ruggs III was allegedly driving 156 MPH before he was involved in a fatal crash, according to authorities. Above, a Chevrolet Corvette that was involved in a fatal accident is shown on November 2, 2021 in Las Vegas, Nevada.
node.description: Ruggs made his first appearance Wednesday morning before a Las Vegas Justice Court judge who set bail at $150,000.
node.content:
["Former Las Vegas Raiders wide receiver Henry Ruggs III was driving at 156 miles per hour and allegedly had a blood-alcohol level twice the legal limit before being involved in a fatal crash, authorities said Wednesday.", "While speaking to reporters, Clark County District Attorney Steve Wolfson said that Ruggs had a blood-alcohol level of .16.", "KLAS-TV reported that Ruggs made his first appearance Wednesday morning before a Las Vegas Justice Court judge, who set the ex-Raiders player's bail at $150,000. Ruggs was also ordered to refrain from consuming alcohol.", "On Tuesday, the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department reported the crash, which occurred approximately 3:39 a.m. local time on Monday. The incident occurred near the intersection of South Rainbow Boulevard and South Spring Valley Parkway, authorities said.", "According to police, Ruggs was driving a Chevrolet Corvette that crashed into the rear end of a Toyota Rav 4. They said that the person in the Toyota died in the crash and Ruggs was charged with driving under the influence \"resulting in death.\"", "This is a breaking news story and will be updated when more information becomes available. ", "", "
Former Las Vegas Raiders wide receiver Henry Ruggs III was allegedly driving 156 MPH before he was involved in a fatal crash, according to authorities. Above, a Chevrolet Corvette that was involved in a fatal accident is shown on November 2, 2021 in Las Vegas, Nevada.
"]
